column5: Well,  I'm finally heading back to Ontario after spending a few years working in Alberta.  Were heading out for the long drive on Dec. 16 which should put us back in the Niagara region sometime on the 18th.  I can't wait.....neither can my Dad!  It's been a while since I have been able to post a report and see some of my friends from years past.  I have an ice fishing trip booked already for the beginning of January on Nippissing and am looking forward to posting a report....hopefully with pics.  Anyways  see you all soon!  Todd
Great to see you back Todd.  Looking forward to seeing you around at some gatherings again.  Joey
Looking forward to doing some fishing and drinking together Todd!
I'll be looking forward to those reports...have a safe drive home  Maureen
Welcome back to what is now called the 'Have Not' province. Hard to believe, eh? Please fill us in on the work opportunities, housing and cost of living is in Alberta.
It'll be great seeing you and your dad again Todd. Safe trip home.
....Hey Cuz be sure to give me a ring when your back. Long time no talk. Safe journey!
Todd,  Welcome back, looking forward to seeing you and your dad again.  Have a safe trip  John

Be real good to have you back Todd & looking forward to reading the musky tales from you & your dad on the Niagara next season.  Sorry you can't get back in time for the 13th, but we'll be there next year again.

Todd, while on the drive back(if you are indeed driving), when you are going through the Ignace area of Northwestern Ontario, do the speed limit!!!!!!!!!!!!  It's locally known as "Wayne's World"   :lol:  :lol:  Wayne(I forget his last name) is the local OPP officer in that area, and is very, very, intimidating. Anything slightly "hinky" gets his attention.
I remember that guy!  It will be great to have you back, Todd.  Have a safe trip.
Buck and I will be looking forward to seeing you-guys in the Spring. We will be back around the first week of April. Maybe we can do something for the Pike opener again!?!? Garry2rs

Thanks everyone.  There's still tons of work out here if your in the trades and the oil industry.  But the cost of living is definitely higher than southern Ontario.  And if you like being able to buy your brand of beer anywhere.....this province isn't for you :-)  Housing is much better than when I first arrived here...the cost of homes has gone down and there are lots of apartments for rent if you want to go that way.  Thanks for the heads up tjsa.  I did the drive about a year and a half ago and stayed right on the limit through all of northern Ontario.  Makes it easier to take in the nice scenery up there.  Hey Garry!  We would love to do something for the Pike opener......I've been missing out the last few seasons.  How's life been treating you down south?
good to see your still doing well Todd... maybe see ya out on Lake O this spring?
